page.title: 16LANDSCAPE OF TYSOE - 2
page.content: The old buildings in the village are built of Hornton stone with Cotswold roofs. Of particular note are the Manor in Upper Tysoe, the parish church of St. Mary, three thached cottages on the Green, two in the Square, one in Back Lane, and three in Upper Tysoe. Several redundant farm barns - in Upper and Lower Tysoe - have been converted into dwellings, thus preserving them from falling into decay. In the last 40 years, many new houses have been built - in a mixture of materials and styles - brick, pebbledash, reconstituted stone, and with wooden fascia boards. Purpose built farm buildings, of steel and corugated asbestos, have been erected to replace the redundant stone barns.
